page.title: 01GAZETTEER_SALTASH,CORNWALL
page.content: {SALTASH}IS SITUATED IN SOUTH EAST CORNWALL.IT IS A BORDER TOWN SEPARATED FROM DEVON BY THE RIVER TAMAR. THE POPULATION OF SALTASH HAS GROWN VERY RAPIDLY.THE 1961 CENSUS SHOWS THE POPULATION AT 7425,1971 SHOWS 9926 AND 1981 SHOWS 12960.IT IS NOW ESTIMATED TO BE 15000.THE REASON FOR THE RAPID EXPANSION WAS THE BUILDING OF THE TAMAR ROAD BRIDGE IN 1961 REPLACING A FERRY.A LARGE PROPORTION OF THE POPULATION IS EMPLOYED AT THE ROYAL NAVAL DOCKYARD IN DEVONPORT.THERE IS CONSIDERABLE WORRY AT THE PRESENT TIME ABOUT REDUNDANCY IN THE DOCKYARD. SALTASH WAS ORIGINALLY CALLED'ESSA' FROM A LOCAL FAMILY CALLED ESSA OR ASHE.QUEEN ELIZABETH 1 IN HER 1584 CHARTER REFERS TO THE FACT THAT ESSA IS NOW SALTASH.THE PREFIX "SALT" WAS ADDED PROBABLY TO NOTE IT'S SITUATION ON THE TIDAL RIVER TAMAR.
